issue.title: [Rust] Enable integration tests
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-6945](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-6945). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
Use docker-compose to generate test files using the Java implementation and then have Rust tests read them.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-6945?focusedCommentId=16975925) by Neville Dipale (nevi_me):*
I've been able to use the existing integration test files, with the exception of the errors that I'm getting.

If I'm able to add timezone support for timestamp, and duration + interval, we might not need to work on this.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-6945?focusedCommentId=17119631) by Andy Grove (andygrove):*
`[~npr]` 

Here is a log file showing output from a test run using the command "docker-compose run conda-integration".

 

[rust-it.log.tgz](rust-it.log.tgz)

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-6945?focusedCommentId=17143962) by Neal Richardson (npr):*
Issue resolved by pull request 7297
<https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/7297>
